attributes.action: pressure the Malawian government to free Steven Monjeza and Tiwonge Chimbalanga who have been imprisoned for a same sex marriage
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Steven Monieza and Tiwonge Chimbalanga face a maximum sentence of 14 years jail, under Malawi’s anti-gay law, section 153 of the penal code, which was originally imposed on the country by the British colonizers during the nineteenth century for starting the process of a same sex marriage. 

The case of Steven and Tiwonge encapsulates the widespread homophobia that is met across Africa - an infringement of freedom and basic human rights. 

Prison conditions in Malawi are harsh, at best.

Please show your support for the British government to lobby Malawi to free these two young men by signing this petition. 

Many thanks
